abstract: Cook County, Ill, sheriff's office is hopeful that an effort to use DNA matching will help identify the unidentified victims of serial killer John Wayne Gacy.
snippet: The sheriff of Cook County, Ill., is hoping to use DNA to identify eight victims of the serial killer John Wayne Gacy, more than 30 years after their deaths.
lead_paragraph: The sheriff of Cook County, Ill., is hoping to use DNA to identify eight victims of the serial killer John Wayne Gacy, more than 30 years after their deaths.

headline.main: A New Effort in Illinois to Use DNA to Identify a Serial Killer’s Victims
headline.print_headline: A New Effort in Illinois To Use DNA to Identify A Serial Killer’s Victims
headline.seo: Sheriff Hopes to Identify John Wayne Gacy Victims Using DNA
